Name: Scarab
Description: A fine scarab made from limestone, with traces of a green glaze in the hollows. The beetle is carefully modelled, with head, clypeus, prothorax with curved base and elytra separated by a single line. The triangular notch characteristic of scarabs of this period is at the top. The double line at the base emphasises the perforation, the legs are deep-cut, detailed and high. The underside is inscribed with text.
